title.narrative: Syria Joint Response 2020-2021

description.narrative: Cordaid will continue as the member of the consortium for the Syria Joint Response 2020, the organisation will provide activities in the sectors of WASH, heath rehabilitation ,and protection (incl use of cash/ vouchers) through partners. The focus areas will be Aleppo and rural Damascus.

Provision of proper and safe places through rehabilitation of educational ,health facilities including WASH facilities, the Activities including MHPSS, social and life skills to promote non-violent communication, conflict resolution, self reliance and respect and activities such as games sports etc.
Cordaid targets beneficiaries who survives through GBV, child protection ,

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Health Thematic Indicators
Number of consultancies for GBV - Number of consultations VBG
Saving Lives Corporate Indicators
Number of beneficiaries reached (HUM)

description.narrative: No. of people reached directly or indirectly through the activities of a Cordaid Humanitarian Aid Intervention

title.narrative: CSH-I1: Number of people benefitting from unconditional and unrestricted cash transfers

description.narrative: Unconditional transfers are provided to beneficiaries without the recipient having to do anything in return in order to receive the assistance . Unrestricted transfers can be used entirely as the recipient chooses i.e. there are no restrictions on how the transfer is spent (Definitions of CALP). It can be delivered e.g. through local banks, shops, traders, local money transfer companies, remittance companies and post offices in either one or several instalments.

title.narrative: Health infrastructure rehabilitation
HEA-I1: Number of health facilities rehabilitated

description.narrative:
Health facility rehabilitated: - physical conditions of the facility prevents/limits the spread of nosocomial infections
- the facility is safe (e.g. against natural hazards) - WASH services available respecting standards
- storage conditions for medical supplies are according to norms. - Medical waste is disposed of according to standards. Use this sub-sector and indicator only if the project contributed substantially to the rehabilitation.

title.narrative: Individual household shelter
SHL-I1: Number of people having access to basic, safe and dignified shelters solutions

description.narrative:
Basic, safe and dignified: - affected individuals have an minimum covered floor area of 3.5m2 per person.
- all shelter solutions and materials meet locally agreed technical and performance standards and are culturally acceptable. - all household (re-)construction is in accordance with safe building practices and standards.
- all household (re-)construction demonstrate involvement of the affected population and/or are culturally acceptable by the affected population.

title.narrative: Prevention and response to violence
PRO-I1: Number of persons reached by the implementation of specific prevention measures

description.narrative:
1) Preventive measure must be built on a thorough analysis of the risks and should - as much as possible - be designed to provide concrete changes in the short/medium term. Changes must be measured in the course of the action. Preventive measure should focus on the increased risks resulting from the crisis, rather than more structural issues. 2) Use the activity description field to describe what measures are foreseen (sensitisation, infrastructure, etc.).3) Number of persons reached by prevention measures must be disaggregated by age and sex at reporting stage.4) If action also includes response activities, please add a custom indicator to reflect this.
Please note that prevention of GBV is captured under PRO-I11.

title.narrative: Accountability
ACC-I1: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

description.narrative:
Participation is defined as the involvement of crisis-affected people in one or more phases of the programme: assessment, design, implementation, monitoring or evaluation. Participation does not take place when activities are carried out in exchange for a salary of 'in-kind' payment unless the affected people are involved in decision-making processes and have an impact on decisions that affect them.
Please describe in the actvity description what this involvement specifically entails and in which phase of the program conflict-affected people are involved.

title.narrative: Child Protection
PRO-I15: Number of children that received support specified to their needs

description.narrative: 1) This indicator covers response to children (girls and boys under 18). 2) Appropriate response is defined as the provision of comprehensive services/assistance based on a thorough analysis of the risks faced by persons. The protection outcome of the response must be well defined. Relevant SOPs (including functional Referral Mechanism) should be followed. 3) Use the activity description field to to describe what services (medical, MHPSS, legal, security, etc.), as well as SOPs are in place. Activities can include psychosocial support to children, Child Friendly Spaces and support to parents to fulfill their protection responsibilities towards their children.

title.narrative: Unconditional and unrestricted cash
CSH-I1: Number of people benefitting from unconditional and unrestricted cash transfers

description.narrative: Unconditional transfers are provided to beneficiaries without the recipient having to do anything in return in order to receive the assistance . Unrestricted transfers can be used entirely as the recipient chooses i.e. there are no restrictions on how the transfer is spent (Definitions of CALP). It can be delivered e.g. through local banks, shops, traders, local money transfer companies, remittance companies and post offices in either one or several instalments.

title.narrative: Prevention and response to COVID-19 pandemic
COV-I1: Number of people receiving COVID-19 related assistance

description.narrative: COVID-19 related assistance: Any activities relating to preparedness, prevention or response to COVID-19 as defined within the Global HRP.
